name: GonzoVR
description:
GonzoVR is a real-world live VR broadcast experience where you can watch and chat in real time with streamers during scheduled broadcasts, collaboratively control a VR camera by driving it around on an RC car, and interact with elements of the real world, including a really cool dog named Gonzo.

There are two main broadcast types:

Streamercasts: scheduled live streams with people who you can interact with
Features:
  • Watch live scheduled broadcasts in 3D 360 VR with lives streamers from our VR Livestream studio in LA
  • Speak voice to voice to broadcaster and other viewers
  • Chat with other viewers through text
  • Interact with arduino robots in the studio
  • Watch videos of archived broadcasts
  • Engage with AR markers around the room: these could be gifs, videos, links, or triggers to activate arduino robots

and

Vroommate: a constant stream from a camera mounted on a small car that users can drive around
Features:
  • Collaboratively drive an RC car around the dev's living room
  • Chat with other drivers
  • Buy treats for Gonzo
  • Engage with AR markers around the room: these could be gifs, videos, links, or triggers to activate arduino robots

Streamercasts will be scheduled ahead of time with new broadcasters being added frequently. Vroommate will be available anytime and will have new hidden markers to find every week with secret content to discover.
